title: The outer banks has protected nesting areas for the Piping Plovers, just like we do at Shell Island on Wrightsville beach.  BUT, the area is only protected during the nesting season and then open for public use.  WHY did the state take away our use of the North end of Shell Island from ALL citizens, not just the ones that got the sand or benefit from the dredging that was done when that \nesting\" area was created?"
